author: OKFN
name: world-bank-project-database
notes:
The Projects database provides access to basic information on all of the World Bank's lending projects.
## Details
The World Bank is made up of two unique development institutions owned by 186 member countries: the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) and the International Development Association (IDA).
The World Bank’s projects and operations are designed to support low-income and middle-income countries’ poverty reduction strategies. Countries develop strategies around a range of reforms and investments likely to improve people’s lives.

extras.value: Project id, project name, product line, region, country, lending instrument, lending instrument type, env. Category, approval date, closing date, lending project cost, ibrd comm amt, ida comm amt, total amt, grant amt, team lead, borrower, supplement, imp agency, product line type, project status, pidrecdbwind, sector, theme, main loan credit, sector board code, url, financier, principal, available amount, disbursed amount, approval date, closing date, Bank Team Lead, contract awards, Development outcomes and goals, related info and docs

The World Bank is made up of two unique development institutions owned by 186 member countries: the International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) and the International Development Association (IDA). The World Bank’s projects and operations are designed to support low-income and middle-income countries’ poverty reduction strategies. Countries develop strategies around a range of reforms and investments likely to improve people’s lives.

The Projects database provides access to basic information on all of the World Bank's lending projects.
Shouldn't need it if records are internal#
Long list of recipient countries/areas (http://go.worldbank.org/3Q2636VD60). "The list... is a standard list and some countries or areas will produce no results".

Agriculture, fishing, and forestry, Education, Energy and mining, Finance, Health and other social services, Industry and trade, Information and communications, Public Administration, Law, and Justice, Transportation, Water, sanitation and flood protection
As each project has new data

All sectors/themes are World Bank defined: "Themes... also associated with... Millennium Development Goals." (http://go.worldbank.org/WL951HS4P0); "The UN classification of economic sectors was used as point of reference." (http://go.worldbank.org/D91AOYIPI0). Not classified as a standard ODA.
